articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work studied in over 50 countries
CPRF denounces S. Korean rulers for anti-north campaign
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's work studied in over 50 countries 
 Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Two years have passed since the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "the Juche Philosophy is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy."
   The full text or gist of the work has been reported by more than 70 mass media of over 40 countries during the period. And the work has been disseminated and studied by Juche idea study groups and other public organisations in more than 50 countries in various forms and ways.
   It was published on July 26, Juche 85 (1996). It is clarified in the work that with the establishment of the Juche outlook on social history, the Juche view of history, on the basis of the man-centred philosophical principle, the Juche philosophy has overcome the limitations of the preceding socio-historical outlook and brought a radical change in the socio-historical  view and standpoint.
   A seminar on the work was held in Moscow with the attendance of political, public and academic figures and men of the press and similar seminars by the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Association, the Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Peruvian National Association for the Study of Kim Jong Ilism. It was stressed at the seminars that the work indicates the most principled and fundamental guidelines that parties and governments of all countries as well as Korea should maintain.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun flails suppressive campaign in S. Korea
articles.content:
CPRF denounces S. Korean rulers for anti-north campaign
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland (CPRF) released a statement on Wednesday accusing the South Korean rulers of escalating the anti-north campaign.
   The statement said in part:
   They, in a bid to harass the north, have infiltrated spies into the north in diverse ways and through sea and borders and persistently tried to destroy major establishments.
   Even abroad, South Korean agents bribed, abducted or terrorized north Koreans.
   Some time ago, a councillor of the South Korean embassy in Moscow was deported from Russia for espionage activities. 
 The fact is well illustrative of how active South Korean agents are abroad for espionage on the north.
   The South Korean puppets have also poured a colossal amount of money into arms buildup for war preparations against the north while continuing the anti-north smear campaign through radio and information activities abroad.
   Nevertheless, they are now maliciously slandering the north by inventing a "case" and charging the north with "intrusion" and "disturbance" in the hope of camouflaging their anti-north campaign.
   The anti-north campaign has become all the more frantic since Kang In Dok, an ultra-rightist, took the post of "Minister of National Unification" which is a variant of the "Agency for National Security Planning."
   The South Korean puppets must give up the foolish attempt to get something from disturbing the north, promptly stop infiltration of spies into the north, sabotages and subversive activities and dissolve the "ANSP," the general headquarters of anti-north plots.
   They must also dismiss Kang In Dok from his post at once.
   If they fail to take such practical steps, improvement of inter-Korean relations and any sort of dialogue can hardly be expected.
   If they continue seeking confrontation with the north and infiltrating spies into the north in defiance of our warnings, they should shoulder all the responsibility for the ensuing consequences.

articles.title: Workers' struggle continues in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun flails suppressive campaign in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today comes out with a commentary lashing out at the South Korean fascist clique's brutal suppression of workers for vital rights and democracy.
   On July 13, the puppets called a "meeting of ministers concerned" allegedly to take "measures for labour-management relations" and blared that they would prosecute all strikers and ferret out and arrest prime movers, branding workers' strike "illegal and violent."
   These outrageous utterances show once again the fascist and treacherous nature of the present puppet regime styling itself "government for the people," the analyst says, and continues:
   The South Korean puppets are ruthlessly cracking down upon the struggle of workers to enjoy a life worthy of independent men, branding it as "illegal and violent."
This misdeed is indeed an illegal and violent act.
   What they seek in this brutal supression is to tightly bind workers to the fascist military order, block them from taking part in struggles and, furthermore, emerge from the ruling crisis and ensure the security of their regime.
   This fully reveals that the South Korean regime is not a "government for the people" but a group of murderers against workers and a den of fascist gangsters.
   The frantic suppression of workers will not open any way out for the traitors.
   They had better look straight at the reality and stop the reckless crackdown upon the just struggle of workers at once.

articles.title: On-site guidance for radical changes
articles.content:
Workers' struggle continues in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) announced on July 14 that they would stage a general strike for limited hours and an indefinite powerful struggle in protest against the coercive "structural reforms," a Seoul-based radio reported.
   The organisation urged the puppet government to stop the "structural reforms" and severely punish employers for their illegal deeds including lay-off.
   The KCTU repeatedly declared that if their demands were not met, they would launch a powerful struggle including phased general strikes.
   On the same day, some 3,000 members of the public sector trade unions under the KCTU including the trade unions of "Korea communications" and regional medical insurance's inc. and 200 unionists of the Hyun Dai Heavy Machine Industries held an all-night sit-in in Seoul.
   The trade union of the Han Jin Heavy Industries affiliated with the Pusan regional headquarters of the Democratic Federation of Metal Industrial Trade Unions and the tradeuUnion of the Daewoo Business Group held a protest rally and starting ceremony of strikes simultaneously against the "structural reforms" by the puppet authorities. 
And bus drivers trade unions in Masan, Changwon and Jinhae also went on strikes.
   The trade union of the Dae Woo Business Group organised a strike involving many workers of four factories including some 18,000 unionists of the Dae Woo Motor Company.
   The Pusan regional headquarters held a rally of striking workers and declared that they would fight it out against the anti-social policies of the puppet authorities.
   Meanwhile, the South Korean Federation of Buddhist Movement released a statement in protest against the fascist police's bloody suppression of unionists and denounced the inroads of policemen into the Jogye Temple.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities urged to allow participation of patriotic organizations in festival
articles.content:
On-site guidance for radical changes
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- The forced march for the final victory is successfully proceeding in Korea.
   This year General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to Jagang Province, the Songjin Steel Complex and other sectors of the national economy to  clearly indicate the orientation and way of overcoming difficulties in the economic construction and  making a new great advance.
   His energetic on-site guidance encourages the working people of Korea to make a new  advance in socialist construction. He has taken a long journey of 3,700-odd-day- on-site guidance equivalent to more than 10 years over the past 30 odd years since he began to work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, so as to have miracles and innovations wrought in different domains of the national economy.
   In March 1975 he unfolded a grand blueprint to bring a new turn in the construction of the capital and led the construction of Rakwon Street. As a result, a street lined on each side by modern, high-rise houses for 3,000 households equipped with complete sets of high-quality furniture and goods for cultural life was built in a short period of six months. In this way Changgwang, Munsu, Kwangbok and Thongil streets took shape.
   He visited the Ryongsong Associated Machinery Bureau in May 1984 and said that if a cold roller, key to meeting the ever growing need for iron and steel, is to be produced, a 10,000-ton press should be made. The workers under the bureau, in hearty response to his intention, succeeded in manufacturing a 10,000-ton press by their efforts in a  little over one year in the spirit  they displayed in making the 3,000-ton, 6,000-ton presses before.
   The Anbyon Youth Power Station, symbol of the miracles in the 1990s, is the creation of his on-site guidance on more than 100 occasions.
   People's Army soldiers, holding high the slogan "When the party is determined, we can do anything " completed the vast construction project including waterway tunneling and damming, only in a few years. 
   The West Sea bBrrage across the 8-km rough sea, long-distance belt conveyor lines  at the Unryul Mine and the Komdok Mining Complex and oxygen separators of 6,000 cubic metres and 18,000 cubic metres are the fruition of his ceaseless on-site guidance.

articles.title: Pamphlets distributed to factory districts of S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities urged to allow participation of patriotic organizations in festival
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Spokesmen for the central committees of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and the Korean Democratic Women's Union denounced the South Korean authorities for obstructing the participation of the south Headquarters of Pomminryon (National Alliance for the Country's Reunification) and Hanchongryon (South Korean Federation of University Student Councils) in a pro-reunification festival  and banning their pro-reunification activities.
   In statements released on Wednesday, they said that not allowing the two organizations, which have sponsored August 15 grand pro-reunification festival every year, to participate in this year's is an intolerable mockery of and insult to the entire nation's desire for reunification.
   They demanded that the South Korean authorities promptly stop poking their noses into the non-governmental festival, unconditionally ensure the participation of the two organizations in the festival, abolish the "National Security Law," dissolve the "Agency for National Security Planning" and create an atmosphere of the festival.
   They also urged them to immediately dismiss Kang In Dok, a thorough-paced traitor and separatist, from the post of "Minister of National Unification."

articles.title: S. Korean students vow to fight against authorities
articles.content:
Pamphlets distributed to factory districts of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- "The peerlessly great man lives forever," "Eternal  heaven of the nation"  and other pamphlets were distributed to factory districts of South Korea in the name of the Thaeyang society on the occasion of the fourth death anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, and popular with workers, Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation quoted the Seoul City Committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea as saying.
   The pamphlets concisely and impressively tell about the patriotic feats of the president who made tireless efforts for the nation and fellow countrymen all his life.

articles.title: Scientific symposium on Palhae
articles.content:
S. Korean students vow to fight against authorities
  Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Students of Kyunghee University and Kangwon National University in South Korea evinced their determination to fight it out against the brutal suppression by the fascist clique, reported the South Korean newspaper Hangyore.
   They, who are also deputies to the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), made public "declarations on non-withdrawal from Hanchongryon" each and denounced the fascist clique for arresting and suppressing its members.
   They strongly accused the "security investigation team" of intimidating parents of students under Hanchongryon and shadowing students and wiretapping their  conversations.
   They evinced their firm will and determination to fight in defence of "Hanchongryon", declaring, "We will keep to our faith to the end," "We will defend Hanchongryon" and "We will not surrender to the security-oriented brutal suppression."

articles.title: Moran Hill in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Scientific symposium on Palhae
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- A scientific symposium on the State of Palhae (698-926) was held in Pyongyang on July 14 and 15 under the sponsorship of the history society of the DPRK on the occasion of the 1,300th anniversary of the state.
   Papers presented to the symposium proved that Palhae was a strong state in the east in the middle ages that inherited Koguryo (277 B.C.-668), a feudal state of Korea in the preceding period.  Palhae developed all political, economic, cultural and military sectors of Koguryo on a new basis, which were carried forward by Koryo (918-1392), the first unified state. Palhae held its full-fledged position in the development of the Korean history in the middle ages and decorated its period as well as that of late Silla.
   The papers verified that the main forces who played a positive role in the founding and development of the state of Palhae were Koguryo people who created a developed feudal culture.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea must apologize
articles.content:
Moran Hill in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Moran Hill is located in the heart of Pyongyang.
   It has been famous for its scenic beauty from olden times.
   Originally, it was called Kumsu Hill. Later it was renamed Moran Hill for its shape resembling a peony flower.
   It is a place for entertainment and rest of citizens. 
   When you go to the hill, you may think that you are in the garden of Pyongyang.
   It covers an area of more than 2.5 million square metres. 
Its highest peak is 98 metres above sea level.
   The east side of the hill is a cliff rising above the River Taedong. Flowers of different species bloom and birds chirp, presenting beautiful natural scenery in all seasons. 
   From olden times, people have called the spring landscape of the hill one of eight scenic beauties of Pyongyang.
   There grow nearly 200,000 trees of over 180 species including acacia, pine and fir trees. Inhabiting the hill are birds and animals of over 120 kinds including hares, pheasants, migratory grosbeaks and owls.
   Azalea, sweet brier, magnolia and other flowers come into bloom.
   The hill is blessed with the inner wall, the outer wall, Ulmil Pavilion, Choesung Pavilion and other historical relics. The hill also has  more than 10 pavilions, six ponds and waterfalls.
   Monumental edifices parks, theatres and recreation grounds stand in and around the hill. Among them are Kim Il Sung Stadium, the Arch of Triumph and Kumnung Tunnels.
